@bbejeck interesting thanks. If I understand it right, upon commit, we still store the checkpoint file that indicates how much data we're got in RocksDb and where we need to start off (what offset) after a crash. Now, if we don't flush RocksDb and we crash, will it be the case that the checkpoint file will have information that is not reflected in RocksDB? Thanks.
